page.title: 11PETERHEAD POWER STATION
page.content: Peterhead Power Station was started in 1973 and finished by 1980.It was built because of the amount of people coming to this area finding jobs in the oil industry.The station's 170 metres high chimney makes an unusual impression on the landscape and can be seen from a great distance.Oil is pumped through an underground pipeline,starting at the Harbour of Refuge and going straight to the 3 storage tanks at the station.From there the oil goes to the boiler,where it helps to bring the water to boiling point.The steam produced goes to the turbine which drives a generator,producing electricity.The electricity goes to a transformer,before going onto the National Grid system.
